qas.question: Why did Madrid cede the territory to the US

answers.text: Florida had become a burden to Spain, which could not afford to send settlers or garrisons

qas.question: What was the name of the treaty which ceded florida to the US

answers.text: Adams-Onís Treaty, which took effect in 1821

qas.question: Which president was given control of Florida

answers.text: James Monroe was authorized on March 3, 1821 to take possession of East Florida and West Florida for the United States and provide for initial governance

qas.question: When did East and West Florida Merge

answers.text: On March 30, 1822, the United States merged East Florida and part of West Florida into the Florida Territory

plausible_answers.text: take possession of East Florida and West Florida for the United States

qas.question: Which president failed to take possession of Florida?
What president took possession of North and South Florida?
When did the United States separate East and West Florida?
When did north and south florida join?

context: <a0_0>Florida had become a burden to Spain, which could not afford to send settlers or garrisons<a0_0/>. Madrid therefore decided to cede the territory to the United States through the <a1_0>Adams-Onís Treaty, which took effect in 1821<a1_0/>. President <a2_0><b5_0><b6_0>James Monroe<b6_0/><b5_0/> was authorized on March 3, 1821 to <b4_0>take possession of East Florida and West Florida for the United States<b4_0/> and provide for initial governance<a2_0/>. Andrew Jackson served as military governor of the newly acquired territory, but only for a brief period. <a3_0>On <b7_0><b8_0>March 30, 1822<b8_0/><b7_0/>, the United States merged East Florida and part of West Florida into the Florida Territory<a3_0/>.
